alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 4:35AM EST until January 28 at 9:12PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 AM EST, Automated stream gauges indicated elevated stream levels due to previous thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - At 430 AM EST, the stream gauge above Irish Buffalo Creek on the Rocky River reported a river stage of 14.2 feet. At this stage, flooding is expected near the intersection of Robinson Church Road and Stallings Road, near the Rocky Meadows subdivision. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant, Midland and Fairview In Union County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
